latest.title: Board Change
latest.content:
Today 15:45
RNS Number : 4751S
Amigo Holdings PLC
10 February 2026
NOT FOR RELEASE, PUBLICATION OR DISTRIBUTION, IN WHOLE OR IN PART, IN, INTO OR FROM ANY JURISDICTION WHERE TO DO SO WOULD CONSTITUTE A VIOLATION OF THE RELEVANT LAWS OF SUCH JURISDICTION
THIS ANNOUNCEMENT CONTAINS INSIDE INFORMATION
FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE
10 February 2026
Amigo Holdings PLC
("
Amigo
" "
PLC
" or the "
Company
")
Board Change
Amigo (LSE: AMGO) announces that Jim McColl has resigned as non-executive director of the Company with immediate effect.
In connection with his resignation, Jim has also stepped down as the Co-Chair of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee.
Jim McColl said:
"I joined Amigo because I saw an opportunity to help stabilise the business and support the Board in reversing its fortunes. Over the last two years we have overcome many significant hurdles to preserve the Company and reposition it for the future.
I have enjoyed working with the team at Amigo and know that I leave Amigo in a much stronger position than when I joined. I feel now is the appropriate time for me to step down from the Board."
Craig Ransley, Executive Chairman commented:
"Jim initially joined Amigo as a consultant and later as a director at a particularly challenging period for the Company. He was able to attract some new equity at that time, which played a critical role in maintaining the solvency and life of Amigo.
He has made an important contribution to Amigo assessing reverse takeover opportunities while its legacy lending business was being wound down. That process is now complete, and the Company has established a strategic focus on mining, with initial exploration activity underway in Tanzania.
On behalf of the Board, I would like to thank Jim for his insight, commitment, and support. We recognise that his primary focus is now on the launch and development of Alba Bank and associated financial services initiatives, and we wish him every success in those endeavours."
Following Mr McColl's resignation, the Board comprises four directors, consisting of two executive directors (including the Executive Chairman) and two independent non-executive directors.
Amigo remains mindful of its obligations under the UK Corporate Governance Code to maintain an appropriate balance of skills, experience, independence, and knowledge on the Board and its committees, and will keep Board composition under ongoing review.
Contacts:
Amigo Holdings PLC
investors@amigo.me
Craig Ransley
Executive Chair
Nick Beal
Chief Executive
Sponsor
Beaumont Cornish
0207 628 3396
This announcement contains inside information for the purposes of Regulation 11 of the Market Abuse (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019/310 (as amended). The person responsible for this announcement is Nicholas Beal, Company Secretary.
About Amigo Holdings PLC
Amigo is a public limited company registered in England and Wales with registered number 10024479. The Amigo Shares are listed on the Official List of the London Stock Exchange.

latest.title: Notice of 2026 Annual General Meeting
latest.content:
Today 09:24
RNS Number : 9141Q
Amigo Holdings PLC
29 January 2026
NOT FOR RELEASE, PUBLICATION OR DISTRIBUTION, IN WHOLE OR IN PART, IN, INTO OR FROM ANY JURISDICTION WHERE TO DO SO WOULD CONSTITUTE A VIOLATION OF THE RELEVANT LAWS OF SUCH JURISDICTION
THIS ANNOUNCEMENT CONTAINS INSIDE INFORMATION
FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE
29 January 2026
Amigo Holdings PLC
("
Amigo
" "
PLC
" or the "
Company
")
Notice of 2026 Annual General Meeting ("Notice")
Amigo (LSE: AMGO) announces that its Annual General Meeting ("
AGM
") will be held at Bournemouth Highcliff Marriott Hotel, 105 St Michael's Road, Bournemouth BH2 5DU on Monday 2 March 2026 at 13.00 (GMT).
Shareholders who are not able to attend in person will be able to listen to and view the AGM via webcast. Details of the webcast will be made available on the Company's website in due course: https://www.amigoplc.com/investors.
Amigo will post to its shareholders the Notice convening the AGM together with instructions on how to vote. The Notice will be available shortly on the investor section of the Company's website: www.amigoplc.com and on the National Storage Mechanism.
Contacts:
Amigo Holdings PLC
investors@amigo.me
Craig Ransley
Executive Chair
Nick Beal
Chief Executive
Sponsor
Beaumont Cornish
0207 628 3396
This announcement contains inside information for the purposes of Regulation 11 of the Market Abuse (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019/310 (as amended). The person responsible for this announcement is Nicholas Beal, Company Secretary.

company_30s.what_they_do: AMGO.L is a gold exploration and mining company focused on the rich unmined gold fields of Tanzania.
company_30s.why_they_matter: Tanzania hosts some of the world’s largest untapped gold reserves, and a successful development could tap into global gold demand and supply constraints.
company_30s.current_state: The company is still in the exploration phase, pre‑revenue, and has been raising equity and making board changes to shore up cash. It is trading near historic lows.

rns_narrative: The latest filings show a series of management changes, new board appointments, and a fresh equity raise – all classic survival moves that suggest the company is trying to rebuild.
There are also several notices of share admissions and mandatory convertible note conversions, indicating the company is tightening its capital structure.
These events cluster around a theme of bottom‑ing and preparation for future development rather than immediate growth.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: Total abandonment – the market is largely silent and pessimistic.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: A handful of traders talk about the huge gold reserves and the possibility of a discovery, but the sentiment is weak.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: Many voices warn that the company is still cash‑burning, the gold price is uncertain, and liquidity is thin – a recipe for further decline.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: The chatter has moved from outright panic to a quiet apathy, signalling late‑stage capitulation.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends for the ticker are flat – no public interest is currently driving the price.

near_term_catalysts: A positive exploration report that identifies a new gold deposit.
An increase in global gold prices that makes a project economically viable.
Completion of a financing round or a strategic partnership that injects cash.
Regulatory approval or a first mining contract that demonstrates a path to revenue.
expect_next.watch_for: Look for a sudden spike in trading volume, a break above a key support level, and any signs of short covering such as a rapid rise in share price after a long low.
expect_next.timing_regime: We appear to be in the late wash‑out phase of the crash; a contrarian entry would normally come once a catalyst confirms the bottom.

buy_vs_sell.lean: Neutral – the stock is still waiting for a clear catalyst before we can commit to a bullish stance.
buy_vs_sell.bull_case: If a discovery or financing event happens, the deep crash has historically produced a strong rebound. With limited downside left, a 50% recovery would double the current price.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: Without a catalyst, the company could stay in a thin‑liquidity trap, and a drop in gold prices could keep the price stagnant or push it lower.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: Risk is capped by the remaining thin‑liquidity floor; reward could be a multi‑fold bounce once the catalyst arrives.

playbook.if_bullish: Enter gradually with a small position, add on volume spikes and keep a tight stop below the most recent low. Use the first 20–30% of the position for the entry and add the rest once the price shows sustained strength.
playbook.if_watching: Hold cash or a small position until you see a clear volume surge or a positive news release. The trigger should be a price move above the most recent low with at least 1‑2 days of confirmation.
playbook.if_passing: Skip the trade if the company shows signs of bankruptcy, delisting, or a regulatory ban that would prevent trading.

ai_insights.bottom_line: A deep crash with no current catalyst – classic contrarian play. Wait for a discovery or financing event before committing.
